page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The land we have been surveying is mostly farm land.A motorway,the M6,and a railway run through our rectangle.Almost 50% of our rectangle consists of intensively managed grassland although some of our rectangle was on Won Fell to the east which was mostly rough grazing.The railway,motorway and A6 run N to S following the line of the valley but the A6 runs on slightly higher ground E of both.In the middle squares is Plumpton Hall on the banks of the river Petteril which runs into the Solway Firth near Carlisle.In the W squares are the London to Glasgow railway and motorway.The highest point is 271m above sea level,the lowest is 126m.Carlisle is to the N,Blencathra to the S/W,the Pennines to the S/E.{
